txt.en: The southern tower reports no danger
The central tower reports no danger
The men of this tower have spotted Easterling movement at the ford
Utred has long kept watch against the passage of foes across the ford, and he has asked you to perform a regular patrol of the River Watch forts.

'I will think on the threats of the brigands, [placeholder], but in the meantime, I would ask you to perform the patrol of the ford watch-towers.\n\n'We do this regularly, but I would like to keep my riders close, in case those fool brigands get it into their empty heads to attack the town. I will welcome them... with spears and arrows! Let them come.'
The second southernmost watch-tower can be found on the edge of the Great River in the northern Wold, south-east of Langhold.\n\nYou should ride to the watch-tower and ensure that all is well.

'Hail, Rider! If rider you are... that is not quite a war-steed, but I suppose it will do for now.

'You are on patrol, yes? I am afraid we have spotted movement on the ford -- Easterlings, most like.

'You should ride to the tower on Anduin's edge and see what they have to report. We are safe... for now.'
The central watch-tower can be found on the edge of the Great River in the northern Wold, slightly north of the first tower.\n\nYou should ride to the watch-tower and ensure that all is well.

The highest watch-tower can be found on the tallest hill overlooking the Great River in the northern Wold, slightly north of the first tower.\n\nYou should ride to the watch-tower and ensure that all is well.
'Hail, [placeholder]! Are you on patrol?\n\n'You may ride on, friend. There is nothing out of the ordinary here -- just the ordinary dangers of the plains.'
The watch-tower at the Great River's edge can be found north of the high tower, down the slopes towards the water.\n\nYou should speak with the watchman at the river-edge tower.
'Hail, traveller. Are you on patrol this week? All is clear here; you may ride on.'
'Easterlings are upon us! They have gathered at the ford, and begin to swarm the river-banks on this side. Their numbers are still small -- I believe we still have a chance to fend them off.'
Speak to a guard at the second southernmost watch-tower
Speak to a guard at the central watch-tower
Speak to a watchman at the northern central tower
Speak to the watchman guarding the northernmost tower
